metadata.Title: CVE-2020-5275 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description: In symfony/security-http before versions 4.4.7 and 5.0.7, when a `Firewall`checks access control rule, it iterate overs each rule's attributes andstops as soon as the accessDecisionManager decides to grant access on theattribute, preventing the check of next attributes that should have beentake into account in an unanimous strategy. The accessDecisionManager isnow called with all attributes at once, allowing the unanimous strategybeing applied on each attribute. This issue is patched in versions 4.4.7and 5.0.7.

criterions.comment: symfony: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
